required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Anti-caries Potential of a Sodium Monofluorophosphate and Calcium Sodium Phosphosilicate Dentifrice
clinical_study.official_title: In Situ Study to Confirm the Anti-caries Potential of a 1.1365% w/w Sodium Monofluorophosphate (1500ppm F) Dentifrice

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: In situ study to compare treatment effect on enamel remineralization potential, measured by surface microhardness recovery (SMHR) and Enamel Fluoride Uptake (EFU). The study will explore the efficacy of an experimental sodium monofluorophosphate (SMFP) dentifrice containing calcium sodium phosphosilicate (CSP) in comparison to an experimental SMFP only dentifrice.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Investigator, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage surface microhardness recovery (SMHR) of test dentifrice containing 1500 ppm fluoride as SMFP and 5 % w/w CSP relative to reference dentifrice containing 1500 ppm fluoride as SMFP and 0 % w/w CSP
primary_outcome.description: SMHR test was used to assess the changes in mineralization status of enamel specimens using a Wilson 2100 Hardness tester. SMHR was determined by measuring the length of the indentations of enamel specimens. An increase in the indentation length compared to the baseline indicates softening while decrease in the indentation length represents rehardening of enamel surface. Percent SMHR was calculated from indentation values of enamel specimens at baseline (B), after in-situ hardening (R) and after first demineralization challenge (D1) using formula: [(D1-R)/ (D1-B)]*100.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage SMHR of reference dentifrices containing 500 ppm fluoride as SMFP and 0 % w/w CSP, no fluoride as SMFP and no CSP, and no fluoride as SMFP and 5 % w/w CSP.
secondary_outcome.description: SMHR test was used to assess the changes in mineralization status of enamel specimens using a Wilson 2100 Hardness tester. SMHR was determined by measuring the length of the indentations of enamel specimens. An increase in the indentation length compared to the baseline indicates softening while decrease in the indentation length represents rehardening of enamel surface. Percent SMHR was calculated from indentation values of enamel specimens at baseline (B), after in-situ hardening (R) and after first demineralization challenge (D1) using formula: [(D1-R)/ (D1-B)]*100.

EFU was determined using the microdrill enamel biopsy technique. The amount of fluoride uptake by enamel was calculated based on the amount of fluoride divided by the area of the enamel cores. The difference between treatments was calculated with respect to fluoride uptake by enamel.

arm_group.description: Dentifrice containing high fluoride content as SMFP and CSP
Dentifrice containing high fluoride content as SMFP and no CSP
Dentifrice containing low fluoride content as SMFP and no CSP
Dentifrice containing CSP but no fluoride
Dentifrice containing no CSP and no fluoride

intervention.description: CSP high percentage weight by weight
500 to 1500 parts per million (ppm) of fluoride

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Wears a removable bilateral mandibular partial denture that has good stability and support, with sufficient room on each side in the posterior buccal flange area to accommodate two enamel specimens [required dimensions 12 x 7 millimeters (mm)].
